intro: Crotalaria novae-hollandiae f. lasiophylla, commonly known as the coastal crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes, with distinctive spurred petals. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. This variety is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments, making it a hardy coastal species.
